commit_message:
VNX Driver: delete_hba() instead of remove_hba()

The storops drivers doesn't have a remove_hba() function,
it's called delete_hba(). The confusion comes from the fact
that storops uses -removeHBA argument when calling
naviseccli.

Change-Id: I3f72481442436ddf78c10ab53c161663b05a330a
Closes-bug: #1813525
(cherry picked from commit 6145f8583ad1b1b5c631534b1dc05d8bf89c330e)
(cherry picked from commit acca9dbc7cc990ea8f65b5d96233fa8b8ad9cfe4)
(cherry picked from commit 5efe103c06e11654dada3877b1389618c48041ee)

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ib54071ba270b7a5f6a90ccd026f5547a6fdb3c37

commit_message:
Fix 'container' field in VolumeMapping object

Change the type of 'container' field from Container to ContainerBase.
This will allow a VolumeMapping object reference to any type
of container. This will fix the model of mapping volume to
capsule container.

Change-Id: I2f011b09d2426168153f3a114b7b5d0d93815cff
(cherry picked from commit d15d67cd435ae060fb8c43622d1ebe2f5c25e747)

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-26 15:50:00.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/initiator/test_linuxscsi.py', 'os_brick/initiator/linuxscsi.py', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/test_connector.py'], 'message': 'Improve detection of multipathd running

There is a case where `multipathd show status` should fail, yet it
doesn't exit with an error code. Instead it returns 0. Error is printed
to stdout as "error receiving packet".

This means that enforce will not work as expected.

The multipathd error got fixed here:
https://www.redhat.com/archives/dm-devel/2015-March/msg00136.html

But that patch is missing in some packages, so this patch adds a
workaround to detect the error base on the stdout of the multipathd show
status command.

Change-Id: I1cb29782541e3fe53b0b1744ab36f56464cd2135
(cherry picked from commit 028af871de8a3f45f4cc8342e92d5586a7058e5a)
(cherry picked from commit f2fed213f6b1d36513504d0ec4ebbfeeddc52b94)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve detection of multipathd running

There is a case where `multipathd show status` should fail, yet it
doesn't exit with an error code. Instead it returns 0. Error is printed
to stdout as "error receiving packet".

This means that enforce will not work as expected.

The multipathd error got fixed here:
https://www.redhat.com/archives/dm-devel/2015-March/msg00136.html

But that patch is missing in some packages, so this patch adds a
workaround to detect the error base on the stdout of the multipathd show
status command.

Closes-Bug: #1789699
Change-Id: I1cb29782541e3fe53b0b1744ab36f56464cd2135
(cherry picked from commit 028af871de8a3f45f4cc8342e92d5586a7058e5a)
(cherry picked from commit f2fed213f6b1d36513504d0ec4ebbfeeddc52b94)

subject: Notify all back ends when clustering is complete
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2019-03-26 20:37:03.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_keystone_hooks.py', 'hooks/keystone_hooks.py'], 'message': 'Notify all back ends when clustering is complete

Before this change there was a race condition in which keystone would
hand out its local IP rather than the VIP when in HA mode and never
update clients other than on the identity-service relation.

This change guarantees the other relations are also updated with HA VIP
information.

Change-Id: Ib2ea3103c06a7a06bb1d04b6c7e872f36d12c1c4
'}]
commit_message:
Notify all back ends when clustering is complete

Before this change there was a race condition in which keystone would
hand out its local IP rather than the VIP when in HA mode and never
update clients other than on the identity-service relation.

This change guarantees the other relations are also updated with HA VIP
information.

Change-Id: Ib2ea3103c06a7a06bb1d04b6c7e872f36d12c1c4

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2019-03-26 15:04:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/conductor/test_conductor.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py'], 'message': "Fix incomplete instance data returned after build failure

This change fixes a race in _cleanup_build_artifacts. We were updating
the instance mapping to point at the cell in which the instance was
created before the instance record was complete, i.e. before the related
BDMs and tags were created in the cell DB. Updating the instance mapping
exposes the cell's version of the instance to the API. If the API happened
to fetch it before it was finished being created it would return
incomplete data.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1820337
Change-Id: If966eb1161c842ff49aa530e4482dbca87b61a3e
"}]
commit_message:
Fix incomplete instance data returned after build failure

This change fixes a race in _cleanup_build_artifacts. We were updating
the instance mapping to point at the cell in which the instance was
created before the instance record was complete, i.e. before the related
BDMs and tags were created in the cell DB. Updating the instance mapping
exposes the cell's version of the instance to the API. If the API happened
to fetch it before it was finished being created it would return
incomplete data.

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Closes-Bug: #1820337
Change-Id: If966eb1161c842ff49aa530e4482dbca87b61a3e

We had leap 15 in roles everywhere, yet, we don't exercise it
in the integrated.

We should fix that, as Rocky is supporting (experimentally) both
42.3 and 15.0.

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I73bda119de6859df2a354e9b9848117d643efd6e

commit_message:
Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/stein branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Iaf5206f7ff144b5f6ad6415c2180bdf683ea9686

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-03-27 08:18:32.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/main.yml', 'tasks/ceilometer_install.yml', 'tasks/ceilometer_install_source.yml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Update role for new source build process

The variables ceilometer_developer_mode and ceilometer_venv_download
no longer carry any meaning. This review changes ceilometer to
do the equivalent of what developer_mode was all the time,
meaning that it always builds the venv and never requires
the repo server, but it will use a repo server when available.

As part of this, we move the source build out of its own file
because it's now a single task to include the venv build role.

We also change include_tasks to import_tasks and include_role

Change-Id: Ib6423249ad6d8c24382a0d82229f766d34255ee9
"}]
commit_message:
Update role for new source build process

The variables ceilometer_developer_mode and ceilometer_venv_download
no longer carry any meaning. This review changes ceilometer to
do the equivalent of what developer_mode was all the time,
meaning that it always builds the venv and never requires
the repo server, but it will use a repo server when available.

As part of this, we move the source build out of its own file
because it's now a single task to include the venv build role.
This is just to make it easier to follow the code.

We also change include_tasks to import_tasks and include_role
to import_role so that the tags in the python_venv_build role
will work.

Change-Id: Ib6423249ad6d8c24382a0d82229f766d34255ee9

commit_message:
Update role for new source build process

The variable mistral_developer_mode and mistral_venv_download
no longer carry any meaning. This review changes mistral to
do the equivalent of what developer_mode was all the time,
meaning that it always builds the venv and never requires
the repo server, but it will use a repo server when available.

As part of this, we move the source build out of its own file
because it's now a single task to include the venv build role.
This is just to make it easier to follow the code.

Change-Id: Ibb0a20eeec763f2051c8577da5a91ddc5b9a9e62

commit_message:
use EXT_PARENT_RESOURCE_MAPPING from neutron-lib

The neutron.common.constants.EXT_PARENT_RESOURCE_MAPPING constant lives
in neutron-lib. This patch consumes it by removing it from neutron
and switching all uses over to libs constant.

NeutronLibImpact

Change-Id: Ib7ea6dea58bf211a2da2b103cb526233df04ba49

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: Ic0ad68e63a339b392fac860b69cfd1030a0126d7

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-23 07:33:29.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/tripleo-deploy-openshift'], 'message': "Mount openshift-ansible working dir with 'z' option

On RHEL8, deployment fails with a bunch of permission issue while the
openshift-ansible container image tries to read files from /var/lib/mistral/openshift/openshift/inventory/.

We need to add 'z' option while mounting the
/var/lib/mistral/openshift volume.

Change-Id: I24067f97eb36e475f873e3a3ea06a488fef95d90
Closes-Bug: #1821437
"}]
commit_message:
Mount openshift-ansible working dir with 'z' option

On RHEL8, deployment fails with a bunch of permission issue while the
openshift-ansible container image tries to read files from /var/lib/mistral/openshift/openshift/inventory/.

We need to add 'z' option while mounting the
/var/lib/mistral/openshift volume.

Change-Id: I24067f97eb36e475f873e3a3ea06a488fef95d90
Closes-Bug: #1821437

commit_message:
Update role for new source build process

The variables magum_developer_mode and magnum_venv_download
no longer carry any meaning. This review changes magnum to
do the equivalent of what developer_mode was all the time,
meaning that it always builds the venv and never requires
the repo server, but it will use a repo server when available.

As part of this, we move the source build out of its own file
because it's now a single task to include the venv build role.
This is just to make it easier to follow the code.

Change-Id: I89177a702cd6f31f4b26b4d8fa260fd38a895ba0

commit_message:
Temp set chronyd service state to restarted after config changes

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/644562/ allows the user
to set the state of the chronyd service after config.
This setting is a workaround for:
https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/37512.

This review adds that setting for CI.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/644562
Change-Id: I76b54ecb207ecd89cf76a24565b3161c936fe92c

commit_message:
Add option to force restart state after chrony config change

This review adds a parameter to allow envs that
rely custom ntp servers to force the restart after
config changes - even if the handler is skipped.

See: https://github.com/ansible/ansible/issues/37512

The service state can be set to 'restarted' rather
than the default 'started' - as a workaround to the
ansible bug in the current version in use - 2.6.14.

Change-Id: I17749a1289cb8b0b1e31d88840c9f406bd54d1dd

  model where possible for performance sake. Using a mapped entity

(cherry picked from commit 32c96b1b6c340c10a12d6f598268198083681031)

commit_message:
Add "root_execution" mapped property to WorkflowExecution model

* We need to avoid using direct DB queries w/o using a mapped
  model where possible for performance sake. Using a mapped entity
  property is always more efficient because it's cached in an
  SQLAlchemy session.

Closes-Bug: #1821860

Change-Id: I2d7652ea0cff8f2db7259d285ac98c582bf15b62
(cherry picked from commit 32c96b1b6c340c10a12d6f598268198083681031)

commit_message:
Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://

This is a mechanically generated change to replace openstack.org
git:// URLs with https:// equivalents.

This is in aid of a planned future move of the git hosting
infrastructure to a self-hosted instance of gitea (https://gitea.io),
which does not support the git wire protocol at this stage.

This update should result in no functional change.

For more information see the thread at

 http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-March/003825.html

Change-Id: I015d1926f391bf2e198adf94eba69a1db2cbdef7

subject: Add the support to customize the console access port
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-27 02:07:35.000000000', 'files': ['templates/liberty/nova.conf', 'templates/juno/nova.conf', 'templates/pike/nova.conf', 'config.yaml', 'hooks/nova_cc_common.py', 'hooks/nova_cc_context.py', 'templates/icehouse/nova.conf', 'unit_tests/test_nova_cc_contexts.py', 'templates/rocky/nova.conf', 'templates/newton/nova.conf', 'templates/ocata/nova.conf', 'unit_tests/test_nova_cc_utils.py', 'templates/kilo/nova.conf', 'templates/mitaka/nova.conf'], 'message': 'Add the support to customize the console access port

For novnc, need to set novncproxy_port in proxy nodes and
novncproxy_base_url in nova-compute nodes.
For xvpvnc, need to set xvpvncproxy_port in proxy nodes and
xvpvncproxy_base_url in nova-compute nodes.
For spice, need to set spicehtml5proxy_port in proxy nodes and
spicehtml5proxy_base_url in nova-compute nodes.

When release >= Mitaka, novncproxy_port and xvpvncproxy_port
are moved from [default] section into [vnc] section.
spicehtml5proxy_port is renamed to html5proxy_port and moved
to [spice] section.

So eventually the console access port can be customized by:

juju config nova-cloud-controller console-access-protocol=novnc
juju config nova-cloud-controller console-access-port=xx

If console-access-port is not defined, then default port is 6080
for novpc, 6081 for xvpvnc, 6082 for spice.

Change-Id: I4775ad42ba11b0c28163bf7e3718c56d18a2031f
Closes-Bug: #1800753
Signed-off-by: Zhang Hua <joshua.zhang@canonical.com>
(cherry picked from commit b182ffa7f76c28220f6ee2430e7c320395a55956)
'}]
commit_message:
Add the support to customize the console access port

For novnc, need to set novncproxy_port in proxy nodes and
novncproxy_base_url in nova-compute nodes.
For xvpvnc, need to set xvpvncproxy_port in proxy nodes and
xvpvncproxy_base_url in nova-compute nodes.
For spice, need to set spicehtml5proxy_port in proxy nodes and
spicehtml5proxy_base_url in nova-compute nodes.

When release >= Mitaka, novncproxy_port and xvpvncproxy_port
are moved from [default] section into [vnc] section.
spicehtml5proxy_port is renamed to html5proxy_port and moved
to [spice] section.

So eventually the console access port can be customized by:

juju config nova-cloud-controller console-access-protocol=novnc
juju config nova-cloud-controller console-access-port=xx

If console-access-port is not defined, then default port is 6080
for novpc, 6081 for xvpvnc, 6082 for spice.

Change-Id: I4775ad42ba11b0c28163bf7e3718c56d18a2031f
Closes-Bug: #1800753
Signed-off-by: Zhang Hua <joshua.zhang@canonical.com>
(cherry picked from commit b182ffa7f76c28220f6ee2430e7c320395a55956)

commit_message:
placement: 1.0.0.0rc2 from stable/stein

Prepare an rc2 release of placement as a 1.0.0.0rc2. Three of the
four changes are administrivia. 0c9b38a8 is a bug fix in the
PlacementFixture which is used by nova (in stein and in master).
The bug was found in the window of time after placement had cut
stable/stein and before nova did.

No further backports are pending.

$ git log --oneline --no-merges 1.0.0.0rc1..bbd90ca2a671b76cda6844a3a8de5c46f587b7a5
bbd90ca2 (origin/stable/stein, gerrit/stable/stein) Replace openstack.org git:// URLs with https://
0c9b38a8 Add register_opts param to PlacementFixture
60efe8ac Update UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/stein
de7c123c Update .gitreview for stable/stein

Change-Id: I9719f9a139755ac2848fb259c77e881350006e8a

commit_message:
Extract announce info from deliverable file

There were some undocumented expectations for formatting information in
repo's README files to be extracted by the email announcement scripts
that many (most?) repos are not following. Since we have information
like the bug reporting details in the deliverable files, this attempts
to parse the info from there.

Story: #2005279
Task: #30132

Change-Id: I31643d9c4f22c199c9fc385711fdf530c2836631
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Fix announce email paths
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-25 16:22:14.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/release_notes.py', 'tools/announce.sh'], 'message': 'Fix announce email paths

Our announce email included a few errors in the paths provided. If the
git remote.origin.url ended with ".git" the tarball path was wrong. We
were also using the package name for git and doc paths incorrectly. This
fixes the name used so the resulting links are correct.

Story: #2005279
Task: #30131

Change-Id: I7a64761778b7391c0f3188b1177f03a7e712bd2a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix announce email paths

Our announce email included a few errors in the paths provided. If the
git remote.origin.url ended with ".git" the tarball path was wrong. We
were also using the package name for git and doc paths incorrectly. This
fixes the name used so the resulting links are correct.

Story: #2005279
Task: #30131

Change-Id: I7a64761778b7391c0f3188b1177f03a7e712bd2a
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

subject: Support admin to specify project to create snapshot
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-12-19 03:46:30.000000000', 'files': ['specs/stein/approved/support-admin-to-specify-project-to-create-snapshot.rst'], 'message': 'Support admin to specify project to create snapshot

The snapshot created by the super administrator for the instance under

the project has the permission to create or restore an instance using
the instance snapshot.

Blueprint: support-admin-to-specify-project-to-create-snapshot
Change-Id: Icc4c1b72e3cbff346780a1e5ccd1fe8f6f3bea74

commit_message:
Support admin to specify project to create snapshot

The snapshot created by the super administrator for the instance under
the project should belong to the target project, so that the user under
the project has the permission to create or restore an instance using
the instance snapshot.

Blueprint: support-admin-to-specify-project-to-create-snapshot
Change-Id: Icc4c1b72e3cbff346780a1e5ccd1fe8f6f3bea74

subject: Use temporary redirects for future series
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-26 06:00:37.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/_redirections.py'], 'message': "Use temporary redirects for future series

Per [1],

> [Permanent redirections] are meant to last forever. They imply that
> the original URL should not be used anymore and that the new one is
> preferred. Search engine robots trigger an update of the associated
> URL for the resource in their indexes.

That doesn't seem like a good idea when we *know* that the redirect
location is going to change, and on a reasonably short time scale. Use
302 instead; 303 or 307 would probably work as well, but 302 should have
very broad client support.

[1] https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Redirections

Change-Id: Ia2e8c46c27ac97217576afdd1677efba4b99fc37
"}]
commit_message:
Use temporary redirects for future series

Per [1],

> [Permanent redirections] are meant to last forever. They imply that
> the original URL should not be used anymore and that the new one is
> preferred. Search engine robots trigger an update of the associated
> URL for the resource in their indexes.

That doesn't seem like a good idea when we *know* that the redirect
location is going to change, and on a reasonably short time scale. Use
302 instead; 303 or 307 would probably work as well, but 302 should have
very broad client support.

[1] https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Redirections

Change-Id: Ia2e8c46c27ac97217576afdd1677efba4b99fc37

subject: Add option to disable container builds on specific hosts
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2019-03-26 19:12:55.000000000', 'files': ['osa_toolkit/generate.py', 'releasenotes/notes/no_containers_option-39034d48825e8966.yaml'], 'message': 'Add option to disable container builds on specific hosts

This change adds an option to disable any and all containers within a given host
The new option "no_containers" is a boolean option and has a default value of
false. When set true no containers will be created in inventory for a given machine.

This will allow deployers to simply disable container builds on specific machines
when nessisary. This is usefule when a deployer simply wants to deploy openstack
in a flattened environment. This has also been useful in cases where
infrastructure hosts may reside within virtualization solutions like OpenStack,
VirtualBox, or VMWare which implement strong port security rules which makes
container networking difficult or impossible.

To implement the change simply add the "no_containers: true|false" option to
a host entry in the openstack_user_config.yml

Change-Id: I8bed3e498a431e2683956e1009d9d9ece9fdb272
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9229315a1adea8ebbddb182c20e4d1202fc0168a)
'}]
commit_message:
Add option to disable container builds on specific hosts

This change adds an option to disable any and all containers within a given host
The new option "no_containers" is a boolean option and has a default value of
false. When set true no containers will be created in inventory for a given machine.

This will allow deployers to simply disable container builds on specific machines
when nessisary. This is usefule when a deployer simply wants to deploy openstack
in a flattened environment. This has also been useful in cases where
infrastructure hosts may reside within virtualization solutions like OpenStack,
VirtualBox, or VMWare which implement strong port security rules which makes
container networking difficult or impossible.

To implement the change simply add the "no_containers: true|false" option to
a host entry in the openstack_user_config.yml

Change-Id: I8bed3e498a431e2683956e1009d9d9ece9fdb272
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin@cloudnull.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9229315a1adea8ebbddb182c20e4d1202fc0168a)

subject: Fix HashMap field mapping comparison
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2019-03-26 16:25:54.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/tests/test_hashmap.py', 'cloudkitty/rating/hash/__init__.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-hashmap-mapping-value-match-56570510203ce3e5.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix HashMap field mapping comparison

This fixes hashmap field mapping comparisons by ensuring that the
metadata to compare is a string. Some metadatas can be integers or floats
(vcpus or ram for example). Given that field values are stored as strings,
these values did never match.

Change-Id: I6d768418d2e91ab62d6af4cb670c148424828fd4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix HashMap field mapping comparison

This fixes hashmap field mapping comparisons by ensuring that the
metadata to compare is a string. Some metadatas can be integers or floats
(vcpus or ram for example). Given that field values are stored as strings,
these values did never match.

Change-Id: I6d768418d2e91ab62d6af4cb670c148424828fd4

commit_message:
Fix HashMap field mapping comparison

This fixes hashmap field mapping comparisons by ensuring that the
metadata to compare is a string. Some metadatas can be integers or floats
(vcpus or ram for example). Given that field values are stored as strings,
these values did never match.

Change-Id: I6d768418d2e91ab62d6af4cb670c148424828fd4
